title: People
text:
Margaret (Maggi) Mars Brisbin (she/her) is the PI of the MICO lab and Assistant Professor at the University of South Florida College of Marine Science. Maggi completed her Ph.D. at the Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology (Japan), where she worked under Prof. Satoshi Mitarai to comprehensively characterize the symbiosis between acantharian protists and the Haptophyte phytoplankton Phaeocystis. Side projects and ongoing interests from Okinawa include investigating how typhoons and urbanization disturb coastal ecosystems. Recent research focuses on positive and negative interactions between Phaeocystis and their colony microbiomes, and the impact these interactions may have on bloom formation. Maggi is passionate about science communication, outreach, and building an inclusive and supportive lab.   









 


Andreas Norlin is joining the MICO lab as a Ph.D. student in Fall 2023.









 


Lydia Ruggles is joining the MICO lab as an M.Sc. student in Fall 2023.









 


Olivia Blondheim is a Ph.D. student in Dr. Chris Stallings’ Fish Ecology Lab at USF CMS. She is collaborating with the MICO lab for her thesis research focusing on how the transition of oyster reefs to magroves due to climate change affects water quality in Tampa Bay.
